resources.string: %1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
Not connected due to low quality network
Automatically connected via network rating provider
Connected to device for Internet access
Sharing local Internet connection with device
Pairing grants access to your contacts and call history when connected.
"Couldn't pair with %1$s because of an incorrect PIN or passkey."
Speed at which the text is spoken
Affects the tone of the synthesised speech
Sets the language-specific voice for the spoken text
Play a short demonstration of speech synthesis
Install the voice data required for speech synthesis

This speech synthesis engine may be able to collect all the text that will be spoken, including personal data like passwords and credit card numbers. It comes from the %s engine. Enable the use of this speech synthesis engine?
This language requires a working network connection for text-to-speech output.
This is an example of speech synthesis
Reset the pitch at which the text is spoken to default.
Developer options are not available for this user
VPN settings are not available for this user
Tethering settings are not available for this user
Access Point Name settings are not available for this user
Debug mode when USB is connected
Show a button in the power menu for taking a bug report
Screen will never sleep while charging
Capture all Bluetooth HCI packets in a file
Allow the bootloader to be unlocked
WARNING: Device protection features will not work on this device while this setting is turned on.
"Select Bluetooth Audio Codec: Bits Per Sample"
Bluetooth Audio LDAC Codec: Playback Quality
"Select Bluetooth Audio LDAC Codec: Playback Quality"
Show options for wireless display certification
Increase Wi‑Fi logging level, show per SSID RSSI in Wi‑Fi Picker
When enabled, Wi‑Fi will be more aggressive in handing over the data connection to mobile, when Wi‑Fi signal is low
Allow/Disallow Wi‑Fi Roam Scans based on the amount of data traffic present at the interface
Select Logger sizes per log buffer
When we are no longer monitoring with the persistent logger, we are required to erase the logger data resident on your device.
Store logger data persistently on device
Select log buffers to store persistently on device
Always keep mobile data active, even when Wi‑Fi is active (for fast network switching).
Use tethering hardware acceleration if available
USB debugging is intended for development purposes only. Use it to copy data between your computer and your device, install apps on your device without notification and read log data.
"Revoke access to USB debugging from all computers you've previously authorised?"
These settings are intended for development use only. They can cause your device and the applications on it to break or misbehave.
Check apps installed via ADB/ADT for harmful behaviour.
Bluetooth devices without names (MAC addresses only) will be displayed
Disables the Bluetooth absolute volume feature in case of volume issues with remote devices such as unacceptably loud volume or lack of control.
Allow ringtones on the phone to be played on Bluetooth headsets
Enable terminal app that offers local shell access
Debugged application waits for debugger to attach before executing
TelephonyMonitor will collect logs when it detects a problem with telephony/modem functionality and prompt notification to user to file a bug
Flash screen when apps do long operations on main thread
Screen overlay showing current touch data
Flash entire window surfaces when they update
Flash views inside windows when drawn with the GPU
Flash hardware layers green when they update
Always use GPU for screen compositing
Disable automatic routing to USB audio peripherals
Force screen layout direction to RTL for all locales
Force use of GPU for 2D drawing
Enable 4x MSAA in OpenGL ES 2.0 apps
Destroy every activity as soon as the user leaves it
Show App Not Responding dialogue for background apps
Displays on-screen warning when an app posts a notification without a valid channel
Makes any app eligible to be written to external storage, regardless of manifest values
Make all activities resizable for multi-window, regardless of manifest values.
Enable support for experimental freeform windows.
Tap to change or remove the password for desktop full backups
View and control currently running services
This choice is no longer valid. Try again.
"Convert data partition to file-based encryption. !!Warning!! This will delete all your data. This feature is alpha, and may not work correctly. Press 'Wipe and convert…' to continue."
This feature is experimental and may affect performance.
About ^1 left based on your usage
^1 - about ^2 left based on your usage
Enter password to perform factory reset in demo mode
This input method may be able to collect all the text that you type, including personal data like passwords and credit card numbers. It comes from the app %1$s. Use this input method?
"Note: After a reboot, this app can't start until you unlock your phone"
"Your phone isn't connected to a mobile data service. To view this information now, go to %s in a web browser."
The Google Terms of Service and Privacy Policy apply. For more details, visit www.google.com/policies.

"Taking too long?
It’s taking a while to connect to mobile data. You can go back and try connecting to another network instead."

"You can: "
Try connecting to mobile data again" "
Use a different network for setup"
If these options don’t work, you can also restart your phone and try again."
Restart your phone and try again, or connect to Wi‑Fi for setup. If you still have trouble activating mobile data, contact your operator.
Your account needs to be updated
Tap here to re-run Setup Wizard.

"Your email, contacts, calendar events and more will sync to this phone. You’re also ready to start downloading apps, music and games from Google Play.
You can add and remove accounts later on by going to Settings > Accounts."
{sim_slots,plural, =1{If you have a SIM card, insert it now}other{If you have SIM cards, insert them now}}

"This phone is currently locked to another operator. You’ll need to use a valid SIM card.
Once you insert your SIM card, it may take a few seconds to activate."
If you have a SIM card, insert it now
If you’re a %1$s subscriber, you’ll get calls, texts and data by downloading an eSIM instead of inserting a SIM card.
Select a SIM for mobile data
Select a SIM for text messages
Your phone will use the mobile network during setup, and you may be charged for this data usage. To avoid possible charges, connect to Wi‑Fi.

"Connecting to a network helps you quickly set up your phone.
Without a connection, you can’t:
"
Sign in to your Google account"
"
Restore apps & data"
"
Get software updates"
"
Automatically set up time and date

"Connecting to a network helps you quickly set up your phone.
Without a connection you can’t:
"
Sign in to your Google account"
"
Get software updates"
"
Automatically set up time and date
To get apps or copy data, connect to a network
This may take a minute or two
This connection is using an insecure or invalid certificate. Choose another network and try again.
This may take a minute or two
Your phone needs to download an update and restart.
By continuing and receiving this software update, you agree to the Google Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.
This may take a minute or two
"Your Android device isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network. To view this information now, visit %s with a web browser."
Continue touching the screen until you hear a beep to enable Accessibility mode.
This will play a retail demo video until the device is factory reset. This mode is for retailers and not intended for personal use.
Transfer apps, photos, music and more. Choose what to copy later.
From an Android or iPhone® device, or the cloud
From an Android device or the cloud
Sign in with your username & password
A backup from an Android phone
Use your old phone to copy data wirelessly
iPhone, iPad, iOS and iTunes are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the US and other countries.
Let Google check all installed apps for potentially harmful behaviour that might affect the security of your device or data.
Set up a few more things now, or find them later in Settings.
Here’s one more thing to set up on your ^1. You can also find it later in Settings.
Customise your ^1 and explore what else it can do
There aren’t any backups available on your other device
Adding your name allows your phone to personalise some apps.
This phone is managed by “%1$s”, which means that some of your information may be visible to other people. To prevent monitoring, reset your phone.
Warning: Resetting will erase all accounts and data on this phone’s internal storage.
Erase all accounts and data on this phone? You can’t undo this action!

"To use this phone, you first have to sign in to an owner’s Google account in use on this phone when it was last reset.
Because you haven’t done so, you have to set up the phone again."
You’ve been added to this phone

Important:"
"
"The phone’s owner can uninstall your apps or remove your space
"
Any other user can accept updated app permissions"
"
Only share this phone with people that you trust
This can take up to 2 minutes.

"To set up this device for your organisation, you’ll first need to connect to a network and download the QR reader.
Once the download is complete, use the camera to scan your organisation’s QR code."
Going back to previous screen due to inactivity
Make sure that you have the right QR code for your organisation, and try again.
Just a few quick steps and your ^1 will be ready to go

"You need a connection to finish the last few setup steps.
When aeroplane mode is on, Wi‑Fi, mobile networks and Bluetooth are disconnected."
For support, tips and tricks, and more, go to Settings > Support & tips
Get more from your Pixel and other Google products, and share your feedback
Time, notification icons and other info will appear on your lock screen

"The SIM card tray is located on the top-left edge of your phone.
Use the SIM ejection tool that comes with your phone to eject the tray and insert a nano SIM card.
Once you insert your SIM card, it may take a few seconds to activate."
